summary: Carlton Goodlett was an individual who was re-elected to the Presidential Board of the World Peace Council (WPC) in May 1971, as documented in a cable from Budapest. The cable details observations on U.S. participants at the WPC meeting, including Goodlett's re-election alongside Herbert Aptheker. Another document, a routing and record sheet, also mentions Goodlett's re-election to the Presidential Board of the WPC during the conference in Budapest from May 13-16, 1971. The third document is a collection of documents and memoranda, primarily related to Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests and classification reviews, concerning individuals and organizations.
significance: Carlton Goodlett's significance in the JFK assassination context is not directly apparent from the provided documents. The documents primarily relate to his involvement with the World Peace Council (WPC) and do not explicitly link him to events surrounding the assassination.
